website_summaries.verdict: Aside from the never-ending name, the HP Photosmart Premium TouchSmart Web All-in-One Printer looks good and prints high-quality photos at competitive speeds. We also appreciate the effort put into the downloadable applications for the interactive touch screen, but the innovation is offset by a hefty price tag. Unless Web connectivity and touch screens are a top priority, we recommend checking out HP's other multifunction printers, which still offer high performance but at a much lower cost.
pros: separate photo and paper trays automatically pick the right size for the job
cons: Onscreen apps take a long time to access and feel gimmicky
applications have a tendency to freeze up

customer_reviews.title: NEVER AGAIN, a noisy and unstable money-pit
customer_reviews.text: NOISY, VERY expensive ink, does NOT print the number of pages advertised AT ALL. Picture quality was exceptional so I gave it 2 stars. SLOW Wireless printing was hit or miss. Duplex (2-sided) does not work for books no matter how it's done (works for me on other printers). Printhead broke within weeks after the warranty expired. Look at other brands If you like this review please rate it "Helpful". Thank you....
customer_reviews.author: Stapes

customer_reviews.title: Return prompt and correct
customer_reviews.text: I initially gave this seller a very poor rating. The product I received was, I felt, possibly not new. I,however, did not open it to find out, because there would be a $20. restocking fee if I did open it and I felt that the package was so taped up that there was a good chance it had been returned to them by someone else. After contacting Amazon and the seller, we returned the printer as "refused" and were promptly refunded the full purchase price, including shipping. I might possibly consider buying from this seller again, as they were very responsive to my complaint and very prompt in completing my return.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen H. Mcdonald

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I had this product for about a year and had no issues, was easy to set up, prints great, wireless works perfect. Printer gets it's own firmware updates through internet, which is a very nice note. One thing, once the original ink runs out get the XL version it last much longer. The printer does tell you, that ink is running low bit to early, just wait till it you really need to change it. But over all it the best multifunctional printer out there, it also got highest ratings with consumer reports magazine.
customer_reviews.author: Vidis

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: I was a little nervous about spending this much money on a printer but Amazon offered a great price so I figured I'd try it. So far the printer is great. I replaced my HP All In One 6180 because the ink was terrible. It would bleed when it got wet, even weeks after printing. Plus, the printing fades dramatically over time. No ink problems with this new printer. It prints really fast and the quality is very good. I'm still learning to use it's extra features. Set up was very simple, right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: dnd517

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the home
customer_reviews.text: This printer is an all-in-one, which is todays standard. Why buy a seperate fax, printer, and copier, and scanner, when you can have it all in one package. Plus it has a touch control panel with web apps which you can easily download items with out looking for them. It is very easy to use, has bluetooth and wi fi, so you can scrap the wires. This is a steal, the most bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.author: Kenyatta Malachi

customer_reviews.title: This is the worst HP Printer I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst HP Printer I have ever owned. Didn't last much over a year. I've replaced it with a very nice HP Photosmart 7520 that I DO recommend,
customer_reviews.author: Susan K. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Great printer- love the wireless feature. Great if you have kids!
customer_reviews.text: i love this product. it was simple to setup and printing quality is good. the only downside is- it is heavy! if you have kids, there are a lot of cute apps for crafts, etc. i would recommend this to a family or small business. can't comment on the fax feature- i've never used it.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Turner

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer replace one with out scanner. The wireless feature has already paid off. The ink is a little expensive but the quality makes it worth it. I will only buy HP printers from now on. helpful hint: replace the ink with the XL version before using it and keep the stock ink that arrives with the printer for a back up...
customer_reviews.author: William Renfro

customer_reviews.title: Web Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer. It sits on our stereo component stand and blends in nicely with all of our components. It is extremely fast, great color; I just wish it had more applications! I looked in several places for this item and found the best price on Amazaon.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara K. Scottini

customer_reviews.title: HP Photosmart Premium TouchSmart Web All-in-One Printer, so far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I've had other HP printers before and Canons and they always did the job I expected. the HP Photosmart Premium TouchSmart Web All-in-One Printer is my first wireless printer and I love the convenience of not having cables to deal with. The instalation was fast and easy on my MAC and the printing quality on par with the other ones I had. I'm still have to work more with the Web feature but I think that I'm going to like it. So far so good, if I can get a couple of good working years out of it it will be worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: giannizelli

customer_reviews.title: Buyer
customer_reviews.text: This printer was a disappointment. We tried to get to the web and never could. I wouldn't recommend this printer to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: R. L Beutler

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer. It does everything I need for it to do. Very pleased with it. Produces great copies, and photos.
customer_reviews.author: Cookiemonster

customer_reviews.title: HP Photosmart Prem All in One Printer c309n
customer_reviews.text: Printer quality for text and pictures are great. Wireless (with web access) so it takes a little longer to get command. Compact and decorative
customer_reviews.author: Bob R

customer_reviews.title: Great value buying through Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Bought this printer to replace my HP 2510 AIO. Great product overall. Only problem i had was similar to the issue I had with my 2510. The scan function and sending the item to a pc on the network is kinda iffy when the computers are connected wireless. With the PCs I have hardwired, no issues at all. Configuration was effortless also with almost no PC interaction. No issues at all when the printer found my network opposed to the 2510. Will recommend.
customer_reviews.author: pedro

customer_reviews.title: Speedy and quality
customer_reviews.text: This printer does everything, but I primarily purchased it for scanning in old photo's and creating slide shows. To that end, the device is excellent. The quality of the scans is very good, picking up details and colors in the photo's that I couldn't see with the naked eye. The printing function seems to work great, although I haven't used it often. Overall, I would recommend this device to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: HP Photosmart Premium WebTouch C309n
customer_reviews.text: So far the printer is your usually expected good performer from HP. Nice feature with the web touch. As with most HP newer inkjet printers, the print catridges are small (low volume), so this is a drawback not just to this model but for all HP inkjet printers. A larger footprint printer to allow for larger capacity cartridges would be nice, but then again, HP wouldn't make as much on ink products.
customer_reviews.author: OHGator

customer_reviews.title: HP All in one Printer
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Works very well. It does go through black ink cartridges fast if you have to find any negatives with it.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine P. Stein

customer_reviews.title: Printer Heaven
customer_reviews.text: I have heard much about HP printers but nothing prepared me for how wonderful this printer performs and operates. I find myself using it even when I don't need to and starring at it for long moments, I think i've fallen in love. To close I can waste no more time in writing this review, as I must return to my C309n. Thanx HP!
customer_reviews.author: britkid21

customer_reviews.title: Excellent photo printer
customer_reviews.text: Goes through ink cartridges a lot faster than I like. I have switched to the XL to see if they might last twice as long, but I'm not sure they do. However this is the complaint of almost any inkjet photo printer
customer_reviews.author: Stan Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: HP Photosmart Printer
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer, the quality of the print is very good and the blue tooth printing feature is a lot of fun!
customer_reviews.author: Flishia Bailey

customer_reviews.title: hp phtotsmart copier fax and scanner
customer_reviews.text: this a very nice fax copier and scanner for the price a little slow but not bad at all
customer_reviews.author: Lois C. Boyes

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with this one
customer_reviews.text: Best printer i've ever purchased. After using this printer it's going to be very dificult to chose another one again in the future. HP outdid themselves in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: melendl

customer_reviews.title: Very good home printer
customer_reviews.text: We find this printer just right for our needs. As antique "technology illiterates" we appreciated the visual prompts for set-up and use.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Good Luck!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased HP Photosmart Premium TouchSmart Web All-in-One Printer on 11/5, arrived 11/12 not working. After numerous attempts problem solving the error displayed through the online and telephone support, I was told that the print heads and ink would need to be replaced. These products would be shipped by ground service, this is what the warrenty on my BRAND NEW printer covered. Six days later, HP is finally sending the parts. 11/23... no parts, still waiting. My rating is based on the support I received and the time I have lost, as I am still unable to rate how this machine works d/t it's broken state. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: MAJ

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing customer service for HP breaking the printer
customer_reviews.text: Great functionality, but... HP provided an online software update that crashed it 4+ months ago. We called HP support who attempted to trouble shoot and determined that a replacement was needed. This is when it got really bad (service)... HP somehow never received faxes, or scanned email receipts on multiple occasions and never replaced it. Delay after delay after delay. I would not recommend HP printers at all. The printer was on warranty and was less than 5 months old when the issues started. We made amazon.com aware and they eventually made it right with us when HP would not.
customer_reviews.author: ron riebe

customer_reviews.title: IT COSTS SO MUCH
customer_reviews.text: This printer's function is perfect, expect its scan function, the range is smaller than legal size, but if you just scan A4, that's fine. For me, it is inconvenience to scan some books. The most thing I hate is that its toner cost me so much money. I recommend you consider twice before buying it. All applictions from the touch screen is just persuade you printing and printing. You can print new, map, coupon, movie ticket, ~!@#$%^&* everything you want, but I am not a rich man!
customer_reviews.author: Lyne

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer for light color photo's and in three months it does not work - it sits at the boot up process saying initializing! I turned it off 5-15 minutes reboot no good. When it did print it printed 4x6 every one or so, saying paper not in tray! I and I Had HP paper in it and ink! It was the worst buy ever! I will never buy another HP printer again!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan M. Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: A powerhouse of a printer!
customer_reviews.text: This is an incredible printer from the folks at HP, my favorite printer company. This is loaded with cool features like touchscreen and being wireless web-enabled. The one drawback for some might be the high price tag. The printer is easy to set up and use. And the prints in produces are of very high quality. I will update my review as I use the printer some more. All my printers except for one has been HP's. I like this because it fax capability, no more having to having to fax papers at the printing store up the street, that will save me a lot of money there. This is one great printer!
customer_reviews.author: Jason P. Pumphrey

customer_reviews.title: Useless Wireless Capabilities
customer_reviews.text: The printer would be a great printer if everything worked like it was supposed to. Unfortunately, the main reason that I bought the printer was for the wireless capabilities so that the whole family (three college students and two online parents). We could only get one laptop to connect, and I couldn't get my own office computer two rooms over to connect, despite effectively connecting it to the network. I can look at it, but I can't use it. If you need the wireless capabilities, it is unreliable. If you don't, buy a cheaper printer.
customer_reviews.author: Frustrated Wirelessly

customer_reviews.title: Awful Printer
customer_reviews.text: Nothing but trouble with this printer. I have had to use a work around to scan photo from day one. I must insert a CF disk and scan to that disk first, then transfer to my Mac. Now I have a "printer jam" but there is no paper jammed in the machine. The machine is now useless. It will cost more to repair it than it will to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: Horrible!
customer_reviews.text: I only buy HP printers. This is absolutely horrible! At first I was impressed, but too many little glitches. If you run out of an ink cartridge, you cant fax, copy, go online....until you replace the cartridge. Very annoying since its NOT just a printer. All sorts of other things...slowwwww start up....too many to list. If your thinking about buying this, look at other HP products.
customer_reviews.author: SueG

customer_reviews.title: You can't fix paper jams easily. It doesn't print pictures well AT ALL and ...
customer_reviews.text: Not liking this printer much. Please don't buy it..... find another one. You can't fix paper jams easily. It doesn't print pictures well AT ALL and that is why I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Novak

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install---easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is the umteenth HP printer I have installed in the last 20 years. USB Installation on my XP system went flawlessly, and all functions seem to work as advertised. One error in the product description almost caused me not to purchase it: The width was listed as 22 inches. The opening where the printer was to go is 21 3/4 inches wide. I went on and ordered it, thinking I would have to rearrange things a little. To mu suprise, the unit is only 17 1/2 inches wide, so it fit right in. I hope my good experience continues.
customer_reviews.author: A. Creasy

customer_reviews.title: Nice Printer
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up and use. It does print a little slow but the print quality is very good. Overall it's a nice printer and does a good job but because of the expense may not be a good choice for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Awful Product
customer_reviews.text: This abomination eats cartridges; it hangs up incessantly; it can't produce shading in MS Powerpoint. The list goes on. This is excellent for those who must atone for sins in former lives.
customer_reviews.author: Butch Casanova

customer_reviews.title: common problem is "stuck on initializing"
customer_reviews.text: There are pages and pages of internet complaints about this model being "stuck on initializing." Mine does the same. HP has my money. I have a brick.
customer_reviews.author: four cats and a dog

customer_reviews.title: Whatever you want to get out of this
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I discovered that when I called HP the tech guy told me that the printer was 174 days beyond the warranty period though the claim by the seller is that the printer is "new." I can live with that as long as it continues to perform well. The HP that I replaced would have cost a considerable sum to repair, so I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: DV

customer_reviews.title: Hp Ptotosmart Touch All in one printer
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer. Network connection was a snap. Great photo and text printing.
customer_reviews.author: Sharc

customer_reviews.title: Nice Home Printer
customer_reviews.text: Short and simple - great product! Everything just works as stated. It connected easily the first time. Setting up the network was straight forward, and print output is fantastic! Only complaint would be scanning speed, but you can't have everything!
customer_reviews.author: KWJ12

customer_reviews.title: HP C309N All-in-One
customer_reviews.text: Decided to give HP another shot after a couple of years away from their products. The C309N made it just 2 months past the 1 year warranty....and less than 1000 sheets of paper! The gears on the printer carriage fell apart. Up until this point, I was happy with the product. I guess HP hasn't changed the quality of the products they sell yet.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: If you love Firefox, be aware of something with this printer and all C309's!
customer_reviews.text: Upon seeing that Consumer Reports had a good rating on their C309's, I was excited to get this new printer. And guess what came with the computer--asheet that says it doesn't support Firefox. Huh???? I am forced to use IE??? I PREFER Firefox!! But to my surprise, it has printed anything I want to print in Firefox, so am confused what they are talking about. SO...I'm only giving this printer 3 stars out of fear...i.e. will I find out in a bad way what that really means and wish I had never gotten this printer??
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Comon' HP test these things before you sell them
customer_reviews.text: Clearly software developed off-shore (buggy and not well thought out). Fax functions not well thought out at all to say the least. This printer is "SLOW" regardless of what the HP claims. It is unbelievable that they would go to market with something that is half finished. As a result I won't purchase another HP product and neither will my company. HP needs to TEST your stuff first, and not only in India.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Printer from h..l
customer_reviews.text: Printer eats ink too fast and jams paper when it doesn't have a complaint about something else. And when it has a complaint, you cannot use it til it is 'fixed'. Needs refined. My experience is enough to make me never buy another HP product!
customer_reviews.author: Meg C. Steensland

customer_reviews.title: Problems on Windows 7
customer_reviews.text: It is working well with Windows 7 except the printing on CD/DVD. I called HP, but they don't have solution for windows 7. They asked me to use windows xp. They will release the new updates soom. Let's wait....
customer_reviews.author: Jason Mora

product_meta.title: HP Photosmart Premium TouchSmart Web All-in-One Printer
product_meta.description:
HP Photosmart Premium Web All-in-One Printer comes with built in wireless printing and wired networking. The other features are two-sided printing, memory card slots, Color LCD screen and 4 * 6 Color Photo Printing.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
PS Premium Web All-in-One; Ref Guide; HP564 Ink Cartridges -Black, Photo Black, Cyan, Magenta and Yellow; accessory bag; power cord and supply; USB cable 


WHY BUY?



FUNCTIONS




FEATURES






SPECIFICATIONS





REMEMBER ORIGINAL HP INK AND PAPER



SAVE MONEY when you choose high-capacity cartridges over standard ones






WHICH HP ALL-IN-ONE IS RIGHT FOR YOU? 




Compare the good, better and best, side-by-side







 1. Requires an Internet connection to the printer.
 2. Requires a WPS router with an integrated push-button. Wireless performance depends on physical environment and distance from access point.
 3. After first page; see www.hp.com/go/inkjetprinter for details.
 4. Average based on ISO/IEC 24711 or HP testing methodology and continuous printing. Actual yield varies considerably based on content of printed pages and other factors. For details see www.hp.com/go/learnaboutsupplies.
feature_bullets: Borderless photo printing up to 8.5 x 11 inches, 100-sheet input tray and 20-sheet photo tray
Up to 33 ppm black and 32 ppm color print speeds; scans up to 4800 x 4800 dpi (8.5 x 11.7 inches)
Connections include Wi-Fi (802.11b/g/n) and Ethernet networking, Bluetooth, USB, PictBridge and phone (fax)
Print, scan, copy and fax from a single, energy-efficient device with 4.33-inch touchscreen for printing directly from variety of Web partners
Rotate and crop, adjust brightness, or apply color effects before printing with TouchSmart control panel--no PC necessary
Print, scan, copy and fax from a single, energy-efficient device with 4.33-inch touchscreen for printing directly from variety of Web partners
Connections include Wi-Fi (802.11b/g/n) and Ethernet networking, Bluetooth, USB, PictBridge and phone (fax)
Rotate and crop, adjust brightness, or apply color effects before printing with TouchSmart control panel--no PC necessary
Up to 33 ppm black and 32 ppm color print speeds; scans up to 4800 x 4800 dpi (8.5 x 11.7 inches)
Borderless photo printing up to 8.5 x 11 inches; 100-sheet input tray and 20-sheet photo tray

specifications.Customer Reviews: 2.9 out of 5 stars92 ratings2.9 out of 5 stars
